title: Techgnosis
author: Erik Davis
synopsis: An essay that explores how the mystical, the religious, and the esoteric permeate our modern technological culture.

title: Revelation Space (Volume 1)
author: Alastair Reynolds
synopsis: In the distant future, humanity has colonized the stars. An archaeologist searches the remnants of a long-dead alien civilization, uncovering a terrifying threat: the Inhibitors — ancient machines determined to eradicate any intelligent species that may one day challenge them.

title: Diáspora
author: Egan, Greg
synopsis: A post-human epic that explores the far future of humanity — now split into flesh-based humans, digital minds, and robotic intelligences. As cosmic events threaten the galaxy, sentient beings from multiple realities must collaborate to ensure survival and discovery beyond imagination.

title: Coraline
author: Neil Gaiman
synopsis: Coraline discovers a mysterious door in her new home and steps into an alternate world that mirrors her own — but it's sinister, twisted, and ruled by a dark version of her mother. She must use her courage and cleverness to save herself and others trapped in the other world.

title: Hardwired
author: Walter Jon Williams
synopsis: In a dystopian future ravaged by war and corporate dominance, a mercenary pilot fights against oppressive megacorporations using advanced neural implants and high-tech weaponry. This gritty cyberpunk tale explores themes of technology, freedom, and survival.

title: The Stormlight Archive
author: Brandon Sanderson
synopsis: In a world ravaged by supernatural storms and ancient conflicts, several characters struggle to uncover the truth behind their history and save their world from an apocalyptic threat. This saga blends magic, politics, and epic adventure.

title: The Chronicles of Narnia
author: C.S. Lewis
synopsis: A classic fantasy series following the adventures of children who discover the magical land of Narnia, filled with talking animals, mythical creatures, and epic battles between good and evil.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
synopsis: A gripping thriller that follows journalist Mikael Blomkvist and hacker Lisbeth Salander as they investigate a decades-old disappearance in Sweden, uncovering dark secrets and corruption.

title: The Notebook
author: Nicholas Sparks
synopsis: A romantic novel that tells the story of Noah and Allie, whose enduring love faces challenges of time and circumstance as they navigate life's hardships and reunions.

title: New Moon (Luna 1)
author: Ian McDonald
synopsis: In a near-future lunar colony ruled by powerful families, political intrigue and corporate warfare threaten to destabilize life on the Moon. This novel blends hard science fiction with noir thriller elements.

title: Solaris
author: Stanislaw Lem
synopsis: A psychological science fiction novel exploring the interactions between human scientists and the mysterious, sentient ocean on the planet Solaris, challenging perceptions of reality and communication.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
synopsis: A post-apocalyptic novel following a father and son as they journey through a devastated landscape, struggling to survive against all odds while maintaining their humanity.

title: The Black Swan
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb
synopsis: A book exploring the profound impact of rare and unpredictable events—'Black Swan' events—on history, science, and our understanding of the world, challenging traditional risk assessment methods.

title: The Disappearing Spoon
author: Sam Kean
synopsis: An engaging exploration of the periodic table, revealing fascinating stories behind the elements, their discovery, and their impact on history, culture, and science.

title: A History of the World in 100 Objects
author: Neil MacGregor
synopsis: An illustrated exploration of human history through 100 objects from the British Museum, revealing cultural, social, and technological developments across time.

title: The Story of Stuff
author: Annie Leonard
synopsis: An environmental critique exploring the lifecycle of material goods, from production to disposal, highlighting the social and ecological impacts of consumerism.

title: From Russia, with Love
author: Ian Fleming
synopsis: The fifth James Bond novel, in which Bond is tasked with retrieving a decoding device while navigating espionage, danger, and betrayal during the Cold War.

title: Casino Royale
author: Ian Fleming
synopsis: The first James Bond novel, introducing the British secret agent as he takes on a high-stakes baccarat game to bring down a corrupt French agent financing terrorists.

title: Count Zero
author: William Gibson
synopsis: Set in a dystopian future dominated by multinational corporations and cyberspace, this cyberpunk novel follows multiple characters entangled in a web of intrigue involving artificial intelligence and corporate espionage.

title: The Serpent and the Rainbow
author: Wade Davis
synopsis: An investigative account exploring the Haitian practice of zombification and the cultural and pharmacological origins behind it, blending anthropology and real-life mystery.

title: The Dreams in the Witch House
author: H.P. Lovecraft
synopsis: A horror short story following a university student who rents a room in a haunted house and experiences terrifying supernatural events linked to witchcraft and alternate dimensions.

title: At the Mountains of Madness
author: H.P. Lovecraft
synopsis: A chilling horror novella about an Antarctic expedition that uncovers ancient alien ruins and encounters unimaginable cosmic horrors.

title: The call of Cthulhu
author: H.P. Lovecraft
synopsis: A seminal horror short story about the awakening of the ancient cosmic entity Cthulhu, exploring themes of madness, forbidden knowledge, and the insignificance of humanity.

title: VALIS
author: Philip K. Dick
synopsis: A metaphysical science fiction novel exploring themes of reality, religion, and mental illness through the experiences of a man who believes he is contacted by a vast, intelligent cosmic entity called VALIS.

title: Simulacra and Simulation
author: Jean Baudrillard
synopsis: A philosophical treatise analyzing the relationships between reality, symbols, and society, arguing that in postmodern culture, simulations have replaced reality.

title: Through the Looking-Glass, and What Alice Found There
author: Lewis Carroll
synopsis: The sequel to Alice's Adventures in Wonderland, this fantasy novel follows Alice as she steps through a mirror into a whimsical and sometimes puzzling world full of talking flowers, chess pieces, and nonsensical characters.

title: The War of the Worlds
author: H.G. Wells
synopsis: A pioneering science fiction novel depicting a Martian invasion of Earth and humanity’s struggle for survival amidst advanced extraterrestrial technology and destruction.

title: From the Earth to the Moon
author: Jules Verne
synopsis: A classic science fiction novel about a post-American Civil War society that attempts to launch three people to the Moon using a giant cannon.

title: In Cold Blood
author: Truman Capote
synopsis: A pioneering true crime novel that details the brutal murder of a Kansas family and the subsequent investigation, exploring the psychology of the killers and the impact on the community.

title: The Magic Mountain
author: Thomas Mann
synopsis: A profound novel set in a Swiss sanatorium, exploring themes of time, illness, and the clash of ideas in pre-World War I Europe through the experiences of a young man.

title: Exploring the World of Lucid Dreaming
author: Stephen LaBerge
synopsis: A comprehensive guide to the practice and science of lucid dreaming, offering techniques for awareness and control within dreams, as well as explanations of the underlying psychology and physiology.

title: The Return of the Knight in Rusty Armor
author: Robert Fisher
synopsis: After a long journey to get rid of his rusty armor, the medieval knight returns to his castle where he begins a new search, this time with Juliet, his wife. She has evolved in an unexpected direction: she has ceased to be mistress of the castle and has begun to work. If the knight in rusty armor taught us to free ourselves from the emotional armor that suffocates us, his return will teach us to build a relationship based on love.

title: The Lonely City: Adventures in the Art of Being Alone
author: Olivia Laing
synopsis: An exploration of urban loneliness and isolation through art, history, and personal narrative, examining how solitude shapes creativity and identity.

title: The Travelling Cat Chronicles
author: Hiro Arikawa
synopsis: A heartwarming novel about the journey of a man and his beloved cat as they travel across Japan, exploring themes of friendship, loyalty, and the bittersweet nature of life.

title: She Comes First
author: Ian Kerner
synopsis: A guide to female sexual pleasure focusing on oral sex, aiming to improve intimacy and understanding in relationships through practical advice and techniques.

title: The Big Sleep
author: Raymond Chandler
synopsis: A classic hard-boiled detective novel featuring private investigator Philip Marlowe, who uncovers corruption and murder in the dark underbelly of Los Angeles.

title: God: A Human History
author: Reza Aslan
synopsis: An exploration of how humans have imagined and depicted God throughout history, blending anthropology, history, and theology to understand the human quest for the divine.

title: Cleopatra and Frankenstein
author: Coco Mellors
synopsis: A contemporary novel exploring identity, family, and belonging through the intertwined lives of two very different women connected by blood and secrets.

title: Ready Player One
author: Ernest Cline
synopsis: A dystopian science fiction novel set in a near-future where people escape their harsh reality through a virtual reality world called the OASIS, centered around a high-stakes treasure hunt full of 1980s pop culture references.

title: Cismatrix
author: Bruce Sterling
synopsis: A cyberpunk novel exploring a post-singularity future where artificial intelligence and human consciousness intersect, focusing on themes of identity, technology, and societal change.

title: The Diamond Age
author: Neal Stephenson
synopsis: A cyberpunk novel set in a future where nanotechnology has transformed society, focusing on a young girl's education through an interactive, personalized book called the 'Young Lady's Illustrated Primer.'

title: Ghost in the Shell
author: Masamune Shirow
synopsis: A cyberpunk manga set in a futuristic world where cybernetic enhancement is common, following Major Motoko Kusanagi as she investigates cybercrimes and questions the nature of consciousness and identity.

title: Only Forward
author: Michael Marshall Smith
synopsis: A surreal and genre-bending science fiction novel following Stark, a troubleshooter navigating a city divided into bizarre zones, blending mystery, cyberpunk, and psychological elements.

title: Spares
author: Michael Marshall Smith
synopsis: In a gritty future, ex-cop Jack Randall uncovers a horrifying secret involving human clones raised for spare body parts. A gripping mix of cyberpunk, noir, and moral questioning.

title: Just Kids
author: Patti Smith
synopsis: A memoir chronicling Patti Smith’s early years in New York City and her relationship with photographer Robert Mapplethorpe, capturing their artistic growth, struggles, and deep emotional bond.

title: Transmetropolitan
author: Warren Ellis, Darick Robertson
synopsis: A cyberpunk graphic novel series following Spider Jerusalem, a gonzo journalist navigating a dystopian future city, exposing political corruption and societal decay with brutal honesty and dark humor.

title: Altered Carbon 3 Book Collection Set
author: Richard K. Morgan
synopsis: A cyberpunk trilogy following Takeshi Kovacs, an ex-Envoy soldier in a future where human consciousness can be digitized and transferred between bodies. The collection includes 'Altered Carbon', 'Broken Angels', and 'Woken Furies'.

title: Into Neon
author: Matthew A. Goodwin
synopsis: In a dystopian future dominated by corporations, a young man named Moss leaves the security of corporate life to join a resistance movement. As he navigates the neon-lit underworld, he must confront the cost of freedom in a cyberpunk society.

title: Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?
author: Philip K. Dick
synopsis: In a post-apocalyptic future where Earth has been ravaged by nuclear war, bounty hunter Rick Deckard is tasked with 'retiring' rogue androids who blend in among humans. The novel explores themes of identity, empathy, and what it means to be human.

title: The Myth of Sisyphus
author: Albert Camus
synopsis: A foundational philosophical essay in which Albert Camus explores the absurd condition of human existence, using the Greek myth of Sisyphus as a metaphor for the human struggle to find meaning in a meaningless world.

title: Wiccapedia
author: Shawn Robbins, Leanna Greenaway
synopsis: A modern guide to Wicca and witchcraft, offering practical advice on spells, rituals, crystal magic, and the ethical use of white witchcraft in everyday life.

title: Atlas Shrugged
author: Ayn Rand
synopsis: A philosophical novel presenting Rand's Objectivist philosophy, set in a dystopian United States where leading innovators and industrialists mysteriously disappear, exploring themes of individualism, capitalism, and government control.

title: The Art of Dreaming
author: Carlos Castañeda
synopsis: A spiritual and shamanic guide exploring the techniques and philosophy of lucid dreaming and controlled dreaming, teaching how to navigate and transform dream worlds.

title: The Tibetan Book of the Dead (Bardo Thodol)
author: Traditional Tibetan text
synopsis: An ancient Tibetan Buddhist funerary text that guides the consciousness of the deceased through the experiences of the bardo—the intermediate state between death and rebirth.

title: Meditations
author: Marcus Aurelius
synopsis: A series of personal writings by the Roman emperor Marcus Aurelius, offering insights on Stoic philosophy, self-discipline, and resilience in the face of adversity.

title: The Name of the Rose
author: Umberto Eco
synopsis: A historical mystery novel set in a 14th-century Italian monastery, where a friar investigates a series of murders intertwined with theological debates and forbidden knowledge.

title: Les Fleurs du mal
author: Charles Baudelaire
synopsis: A seminal collection of French poetry exploring themes of decadence, eroticism, mortality, and the search for beauty amidst modern life's corruption.

title: A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man
author: James Joyce
synopsis: A semi-autobiographical novel following the formative years of Stephen Dedalus as he grapples with issues of identity, religion, and artistic expression in early 20th century Ireland.

title: The Divine Comedy
author: Dante Alighieri
synopsis: An epic poem divided into three parts—Inferno, Purgatorio, and Paradiso—that chronicles Dante's allegorical journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven, exploring themes of sin, redemption, and divine justice.

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea
author: Jules Verne
synopsis: A classic adventure novel that follows Professor Aronnax, Conseil, and Ned Land as they embark on a voyage aboard the submarine Nautilus, commanded by Captain Nemo, exploring the mysteries of the deep ocean.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
synopsis: A classic novel set in the Jazz Age that explores themes of decadence, idealism, and the American Dream through the mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his obsession with Daisy Buchanan.

title: Your Name
author: Makoto Shinkai
synopsis: A beautifully crafted story of two teenagers who mysteriously begin to swap bodies and lives, exploring themes of love, fate, and connection across time and space.

title: 2001: A Space Odyssey
author: Arthur C. Clarke
synopsis: A science fiction classic that explores human evolution, artificial intelligence, and extraterrestrial life, centered around a mysterious monolith discovered on the Moon and the journey of the spaceship Discovery One.

title: The Invisible Man
author: H.G. Wells
synopsis: A science fiction novel about a scientist who discovers the secret to invisibility but struggles with the consequences of his transformation, exploring themes of identity, isolation, and power.

title: The Way of Zen
author: Alan Watts
synopsis: An accessible introduction to Zen Buddhism, exploring its history, philosophy, and practices, aimed at Western readers interested in spirituality and Eastern thought.

title: Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas
author: Hunter S. Thompson
synopsis: A gonzo journalism classic documenting a drug-fueled trip to Las Vegas, exploring the dark underbelly of the American Dream through a blend of fact and fiction.

title: Norwegian Wood
author: Haruki Murakami
synopsis: A poignant coming-of-age novel about love, loss, and mental health, following Toru Watanabe as he navigates complex relationships during his college years in Tokyo.

title: Kafka on the Shore
author: Haruki Murakami
synopsis: A surreal and complex novel weaving together the stories of a runaway teenager and an elderly man, exploring themes of fate, consciousness, and metaphysical mystery.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
synopsis: A comedic science fiction novel following Arthur Dent as he travels through space after Earth’s destruction, encountering bizarre alien cultures and absurd adventures.

title: Memoirs of a Geisha
author: Arthur Golden
synopsis: A historical novel that tells the fictional story of a young Japanese girl sold into slavery who becomes one of the most celebrated geishas of her time.

title: Twilight Saga
author: Stephenie Meyer
synopsis: A popular young adult vampire romance series following Bella Swan’s life as she falls in love with the vampire Edward Cullen, navigating the challenges of love, danger, and supernatural conflicts.

title: A Monster Calls
author: Patrick Ness
synopsis: A poignant and imaginative novel about a young boy coping with his mother’s terminal illness, guided by a mysterious monster who tells stories that help him face his fears and grief.

title: Foundation Trilogy
author: Isaac Asimov
synopsis: A seminal science fiction series that chronicles the efforts to preserve knowledge and civilization amid the decline of a galactic empire, exploring themes of sociology, politics, and history.

title: Hannibal
author: Thomas Harris
synopsis: The thrilling sequel to The Silence of the Lambs, following the infamous Dr. Hannibal Lecter as he evades capture and confronts his past with FBI agent Clarice Starling.

title: Eat, Pray, Love
author: Elizabeth Gilbert
synopsis: A memoir chronicling the author's journey of self-discovery through Italy, India, and Indonesia, exploring themes of spirituality, healing, and personal growth.

title: The Pillars of the Earth
author: Ken Follett
synopsis: An epic historical novel set in 12th-century England, revolving around the construction of a cathedral in the fictional town of Kingsbridge, exploring themes of ambition, love, and betrayal.

title: Foundation's Edge
author: Isaac Asimov
synopsis: A continuation of the Foundation series, exploring political intrigue and the search for the mythical planet Earth, as the Foundation faces new threats to its dominance.

title: Happy People Read and Drink Coffee
author: Agnes Martin-Lugand
synopsis: A heartfelt novel about overcoming grief and rediscovering happiness, following Diane, who after losing her husband, moves to Ireland to start a new life and heal.

title: Trainspotting
author: Irvine Welsh
synopsis: A gritty and raw novel depicting a group of heroin addicts in Edinburgh, exploring themes of addiction, friendship, and the harsh realities of urban life.

title: Fight Club
author: Chuck Palahniuk
synopsis: A dark and provocative novel about an insomniac narrator who forms an underground fight club as a form of male bonding and rebellion against consumer culture, leading to unexpected chaos.

title: My Year of Rest and Relaxation
author: Ottessa Moshfegh
synopsis: A darkly comic novel about a young woman in New York City who decides to embark on a year-long experiment of pharmaceutical hibernation to escape her life and emotional pain.

title: I Am a Cat
author: Natsume Soseki
synopsis: A satirical novel narrated from the perspective of a nameless cat, providing witty commentary on Japanese society and human nature during the Meiji era.

title: Dune Chronicles
author: Frank Herbert
synopsis: A seminal science fiction series set in a distant future where noble houses vie for control of the desert planet Arrakis, the only source of the valuable spice melange.

title: The Time Traveler's Wife
author: Audrey Niffenegger
synopsis: A romantic novel about a man with a genetic disorder that causes him to involuntarily time travel, and his relationship with his wife as they navigate the challenges of love across time.

title: A Tree Grows in Brooklyn
author: Betty Smith
synopsis: A coming-of-age novel about a young girl growing up in a poor neighborhood of Brooklyn during the early 20th century, exploring themes of family, poverty, and resilience.

title: The Silence of the Lambs
author: Thomas Harris
synopsis: A psychological thriller featuring FBI trainee Clarice Starling as she seeks the help of imprisoned cannibalistic serial killer Hannibal Lecter to catch another serial killer on the loose.

title: Red Dragon
author: Thomas Harris
synopsis: The first novel featuring FBI profiler Will Graham and the infamous Hannibal Lecter, as Graham investigates a serial killer known as the Tooth Fairy.

title: The House of the Spirits Trilogy
author: Isabel Allende
synopsis: A family saga spanning generations, blending magical realism and political history in Chile through the lives of the Trueba family.

title: The Cat Who Loved Books
author: Sosuke Matsukaya
synopsis: A cozy mystery series featuring a librarian and her feline companion who help solve local crimes, blending charm and intrigue.

title: The Tango of the Old Guard
author: Arturo Pérez-Reverte
synopsis: A thrilling novel set in Buenos Aires, where a passionate tango singer becomes embroiled in a mysterious and dangerous game involving love, betrayal, and crime.

title: The Fencing Master
author: Arturo Pérez-Reverte
synopsis: Set in 19th century Spain, this novel follows a fencing instructor who becomes entangled in political intrigue and a mysterious woman’s dangerous past.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
synopsis: An exploration of the history and impact of Homo sapiens, from the emergence of archaic human species to the present, highlighting how biology and culture have shaped human societies.

title: Before the Coffee Gets Cold
author: Toshikazu Kawaguchi
synopsis: A poignant tale set in a small Tokyo café where customers can travel back in time, but only before their coffee gets cold, exploring themes of love, loss, and second chances.

title: American Psycho
author: Bret Easton Ellis
synopsis: A dark and satirical novel that explores the mind of Patrick Bateman, a wealthy New York City investment banker who leads a double life as a serial killer, delving into themes of consumerism, identity, and insanity.

title: The Kybalion
author: Three Initiates
synopsis: A philosophical text that explores the teachings of Hermeticism, presenting seven core principles that explain the nature of reality, the mind, and the universe.

title: All the Fairy Tales of the Brothers Grimm
author: Jacob and Wilhelm Grimm
synopsis: A comprehensive collection of traditional German fairy tales compiled by the Brothers Grimm, featuring classic stories like Cinderella, Hansel and Gretel, and Snow White.

title: Snow Crash
author: Neal Stephenson
synopsis: In a fast-paced cyberpunk future, hacker and pizza delivery driver Hiro Protagonist uncovers a new virtual drug called Snow Crash that threatens both the digital and real worlds.

title: Cyberpunk 2077: Big City Dreams Vol. 1
author: Bartosz Sztybor
synopsis: In the neon-lit streets of Night City, two scavengers—Tasha and Mirek—pursue their dreams amidst chaos and danger. Tasha seeks fame and power, while Mirek longs for meaning and connection. Their paths diverge as they navigate the harsh realities of their world.

title: Cyberpunk: Your Voice
author: Aleksandra Motyka
synopsis: In a neon-lit dystopian future, individuals struggle to maintain their identity amidst the overwhelming influence of technology and corporations. 'Cyberpunk: Your Voice' explores themes of rebellion, identity, and the power of human expression in a world dominated by cybernetic control.

title: Cyberpunk 2077: Blackout
author: Bartosz Sztybor
synopsis: In Night City, Arturo, a braindance technician, uncovers the struggle of users trapped in digital memories and how a blackout might offer escape in a dystopian cyberpunk world.

title: Cyberpunk 2077: no coincidence
author: Bartosz Sztybor
synopsis: A gritty tale set in Night City exploring the lives of mercenaries and hackers where nothing is left to chance, revealing the hidden connections in a cyberpunk dystopia.

title: 1Q84
author: Haruki Murakami
synopsis: A surreal and complex novel blending alternate realities, mysterious cults, and love, following two protagonists navigating a parallel Tokyo in 1984.

title: The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle
author: Haruki Murakami
synopsis: A man named Toru Okada embarks on a search after his wife goes missing, exploring a blend of magical realism, mystery, and deep reflections on life and death.

title: Convenience Store Woman
author: Sayaka Murata
synopsis: Tells the story of Keiko Furukura, a 36-year-old woman who finds solace and identity in working at a Tokyo convenience store.

title: Strange Weather In Tokyo
author: Hiromi Kawakami
synopsis: Follows Tsukiko Omachi, a woman in her thirties, as she reconnects with her former high school teacher, Harutsuna Matsumoto (referred to as Sensei). Their relationship blossoms from a chance encounter in a bar into a gentle, unconventional romance, marked by shared meals, seasonal changes, and quiet moments of companionship.

title: If Cats Disappeared from the World
author: Genki Kawamura
synopsis: An unnamed narrator discovers he's going to die. The devil makes a deal with him to give him more days to live, but in return something has to disappear from the world each day as a trade.

title: Sprawl Trilogy
author: William Gibson
synopsis: The novels are set in a near-future world dominated by corporations and ubiquitous computing. The events of the novels are spaced over 16 years, and although there are familiar characters that appear, each novel tells a self-contained story. It is composed of Neuromancer (1984), Count Zero (1986), and Mona Lisa Overdrive (1988).[1]

title: A Room of One's Own
author: Virginia Woolf
synopsis: Major themes of A Room of One's Own include the underinvestment of society in women's education and a lack of women's voices telling their own stories. It also details the need for women to claim both financial and intellectual freedom to write.

title: Japanese Fairy Tales
author: Yei Theodora Ozaki
synopsis: Is a collection of 22 Japanese folk tales, selected and translated by the author. The book offers a glimpse into Japan's rich oral tradition, exploring themes such as love, honor, kindness, and respect for nature through stories that have been passed down from generation to generation.

title: One Thousand and One Nights
author: Unknown
synopsis: Is a collection of Middle Eastern and South Asian stories framed by the narrative of Scheherazade. To escape execution, she tells captivating stories to the vengeful King Shahryar each night, leaving him in suspense to hear the end, thus prolonging her life for another thousand and one nights
